hedline.hl1: After-School Program That Adjusts to Students' Levels

abstract.p: Score Educational Center opens new after-school center in Harlem, NYC, that features computers with SuccessMaker software (S)

block.p: Score Educational Centers brought its after-school program to Harlem last month, when it opened at 121 West 125th Street (between Lenox Avenue and Adam Clayton Powell Jr. Boulevard).

The new center has 20 computer stations so members can use SuccessMaker, a computerized curriculum that is programmed to adjust to the level and abilities of individual students in kindergarten through 10th grade. Students can enroll at the Harlem location for $99 per month, in addition to a one-time family registration fee of $100, and attend two hourlong unscheduled sessions each week. (Prices vary at different Score locations.)

The Score academic coaches, recent college graduates, serve as role models and motivators. They attend an education and business training program.
Score first opened in 1992 in Palo Alto, Calif., and now has 105 centers in the United States, 5 in New York.
